page.title: 12Disabled-Chalfont St Peter.
page.content: The Chiltern Cheshire Home in Gerrards Cross is one of the 220 Cheshire Homes throughout the world.In this home there are 19 people:12 women and 7 men,who are loved and cared for.Out of the 19 there is 1 accident victim,4 were born disabled and the remaining 14 were disabled by various illnesses.In the Home there are 40 Social Workers and 2 trained Nurses;this means there are roughly 2 Social Workers per resident. There are only 2 trained Nurses,as the residents do not need much medical care,only affection and love. A visit to Lourdes is arranged every year.The Duchess of Kent opened this Home in 1968. The patients are taken out as often as possible.There is no shortage of volunteers to take them and help.They regularly go to church.
